content: Can you log on to your account via web mail? Nobody else can just get to your mail account.
creator: christ1

content:
The versions is 115.6.1 (64-bit) on Windows 11.

The error console shows the following error:

Uncaught (in promise) NS_ERROR_FAILURE: Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIMsgFolder.server]

This seems to be the same issue reported in Bug 1869685.

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1869685
creator: kenyo1229

content: See if this helps. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1418550
creator: christ1

content:
It's called Vertical View Layout with Card View vs. Classic View Layout with Table View. What you want is the latter. To switch to classic view

  • press Alt or F10 to bring up the menu bar in case it's hidden
  • View (Alt-V) - Layout
  • check Classic View
creator: christ1

content: You can hover over the address book(s) to remove, click on the three dots that appear to the right, and then click on "Delete" to remove them. Just note you cannot delete the default address books, "Personal Address Book" and "Collected Addresses".
creator: bbonacci

content: The message is likely in a different label. Check online to see in what label Gmail placed it. Gmail does some of its own email management, so you may need to set a filter for this message's origin.
creator: davidsk

content: I don't know what labels are!
creator: r101gtx

content: IN Gmail, the term 'label' is equivalent to what thunderbird calls folders.
creator: davidsk

content: But surely any posts go to whichever folder TB puts them in. This particular email does not appear to be in any.
creator: r101gtx

content: Your statement contradicts the reality you posted. The message isn't there. Did you check online and identify where the message is filed?

content: A simple way would be - delete the folder at c:\users\l<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird - reinstall thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you David. That worked.

content: Kewl! You're welcome.
